content:
I just noticed Zulip now has a feature to mark topics/questions as resolved, by clicking a little tick mark next to the topic title. This simply edits the topic title to add a tick mark it seems https://zulip.com/help/resolve-a-topic.
Should we use this and/or encourage people to mark things as resolved?
I can see this being helpful personally when scanning topics to see if there are some unanswered questions recently, but conversely it could be annoying if we ended up like stack exchange telling people each other to tick stuff all the time (imo).
Also testing: it does this which is maybe also annoying?
Alex J. Best has marked this topic as resolved.
Alex J. Best has marked this topic as unresolved.
I think other people can mark things as resolved?
Hmm, there's a button for it for me but I can't seem to actually mark it, never mind then
Bryan Gin-ge Chen has marked this topic as resolved.
Bryan Gin-ge Chen has marked this topic as unresolved.
Perhaps topic-creators and zulip admins?
Yep, the article says anyone with the ability to edit the topic can do it.
I've noticed that marking a topic as resolved marks every message above it as "edited", which is a little odd.
Oh no, because they edit the check mark into the title for every single message...?
It's only the initial one in this case: https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/270676-lean4/topic/.E2.9C.94.203.20or.204.3F
In the thread you've linked to, both messages show as edited for me.
The edited marker is sometimes in the left margin and sometimes to the right of the name
I have never seen an edit marker in the left margin. A/B testing maybe?

In the thread you've linked to, both messages show as edited for me.

For me as well, after reloading the page :fear:
I feel like "resolving topics" is a nice idea that was implemented too hastily.
It has too many annoying side effects currently.
Like bumping up the notification counter, and the issue mentioned in OP
Can we disable the resolving feature?
I don't think so
"Resolve topic should mark topic as unread only for participants" https://github.com/zulip/zulip/issues/19709
Ooh, this one is also fun https://github.com/zulip/zulip/issues/19651
Another one: https://github.com/zulip/zulip/issues/19916
Should we ask for a zulip setting that disables the "resolve" feature?
There is https://github.com/zulip/zulip/issues/19955
Let's :+1: that issue
